thread.title: Ilford turned into 'war zone' as police storm town centre and find injured man in car
thread.title_full: Ilford turned into 'war zone' as police storm town centre and find injured man in car

author: Chloe Chaplain
title: Ilford turned into 'war zone' as police storm town centre and find injured man in car
text:
Sunday 5 February 2017 17:22 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Ilford: A man was found in a car suffering from injuries 
Ilford town centre was described as a “war zone” on Sunday after police stormed the area and found an injured man in a car. 
Officers from the Met's gang unit found the 22-year-old man with “life changing” injuries in a car on High Road just before 5am. 
He was rushed to an east London hospital. 
One bystander, Samuel Kelley, tweeted: “War zone in Ilford this morning. Loads of police vans, police cars and ambulances and people. The joys of getting the night bus to work.” 
Officers arrested one person but no further details about the arrest were given. War zone in Ilford this morning. Loads of Police Vans,Police Cars and Ambulance's and people. The joys of getting the night bus to work. — Samuel Kelly (@SamuelKelly333) February 5, 2017 
A police spokesman said: “Police were called by the London Ambulance Service on Sunday, 5 February at 4:57am to High Road, Ilford following a report of a man injured. Woman 'assaulted and called race traitor' on Tube over Trump protest 
“Officers found a 22-year-old man injured inside a car. He was taken to an east London hospital where he remains with life changing injuries. 
“One arrest (no further details) has been made and they are currently in custody at an east London police station.” 
Detectives from the Trident and Area Crime Command – the Met’s gang unit -are investigating. 
They have asked anyone who witnessed the incident or has information to contact police on 101 or via Twitter @MetCC, or Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. More about:
